message: You try to push the door open, but it's blocked from the inside. Best to try the other door.
With all that gold that you helped us get back, we plan to fix the bridge so we will be able ship our beer to the west.

replies.text: "Bridge"? What bridge? To the west?
Oh, that's great news indeed! It's going to make my life easier.

message: Don't you know? The bridge that crosses over the Sutdover River that flows between here and Stoutford. It's been broken for a while now.

replies.text: N

message: It should be ready by the time you get there.
The bridge that crosses over the Sutdover River has been repaired thanks to you.

replies.text: Yes. I am aware. In fact, I've already used.
N
N

message: You can't continue over the broken boards. It's time to turn around and find another way across.

replies.text: N

message: Hey, kid! Just where do you think you're going?

replies.text: Across the bridge, of course. Afterall, I can't swim.
Nowhere...I guess.

message: The bridge is broken. You're going nowhere.

replies.text: N
N
I want my gold back. You thief!
N

message: Let me guess, you're wondering if I know how to cross the river?

replies.text: Well, do you?

message: Please move along. There's nothing to see here.

replies.text: Yes, ma'am.

message: Well, a matter of fact, I do. I have a board right here under the bridge that you can place over the hole. But it's going to cost you 1000 gold.

replies.text: Wow! All you thieves are alike. Here, take it.

message: Great! Now, let me see. Where is that board?

replies.text: N

message: [Seraphina bends down to look under the bridge.]

replies.text: N

message: Um, it's not here.

replies.text: What do you mean "it's not here"? Where is it?

message: It must have drifted down river. Sorry!

replies.text: "Sorry"? I want my gold back.

message: Maybe next time you come by I'll have the board?
Do I know you?

replies.text: Umar will here about this!
N

message: I'm just the muscle around here. Go talk to Defy.
I'm just the...um...

replies.text: brains?

message: Um, yes. One of those.
Are you lost, kid?
As you step between the trees, the crunch of the dry leaves beneath your feet startle you.

replies.text: N
N

message: Shh! What was that? Did you guys here that?

replies.text: N

message: I heard nothing. Greedy, you need to relax. Here, have a Bandit's Brew.
There it is again! Please tell me that you guys heard that?

replies.text: N

message: Greedy! That's enough! Stop it. We are safe here.

replies.text: Wait a minute, I recognize those guys.

message: Ugh. Whatever.
You should get a better understanding of who these men are before you crash the party.

replies.text: N

message: Lookie what we have here! Sullengard's five most wanted men, all in one location. This is my lucky day.

replies.text: Hello boys!

message: Oh, it's the child from Crossglen. Umar's little toy.

replies.text: Watch it, thief!

message: Why are you yelling from across the woods? Please walk over here and we can talk.

replies.text: OK.

message: Oh, how interesting your timing is.

replies.text: Really? And why is that?

message: Well, you see, we are in kind of a predicament.

replies.text: Oh, you are feeling guility for what you did to the great people of Sullengard and want to turn yourselves in, but don't want to go to jail?

message: Now that's funny. No! Now back to what I was trying to tell you...

replies.text: N

message: We are planning a heist, but we need your "skills" to pull it off.

replies.text: Forget it!
My "skills" are not for hire.

message: Please. Just hear me out.

replies.text: N

message: We have knowledge of this vast repository of gold and other treasures, but it is well secured under lock and key.

replies.text: OK. You had me a "treasures". Please go on.
And you want me to help you return it to its rightful owners?

message: The problem of needing the key is where your "skills" come in.

replies.text: These "skills" that you keep mentioning, what are they?

message: [Laughing loudly]. Kid, you are certainly as funny as you are funny looking, I'll tell you that right now. Now, back on topic...

replies.text: N

message: I was just getting to that. If you would stop interrupting me, I could get to the plan quicker and how you play a major role in it.

replies.text: A "major" role you said. So what, I get fifty percent of the loot?
Oh, sorry. Please continue.

message: Again with the humor. No, you will not be getting fifty percent. Anyways...

replies.text: N

message: Well, before I get into anymore details. Hey Alaric [the lost traveler's real name], do we trust this kid enough to tell him the details?

replies.text: N

message: Well Defy, $playername did let me go after discovering my crime.

replies.text: [Keep quiet about the facts and agree, for now] That's true.

message: That's fair enough. Now let us move on to the details, shall we?

replies.text: Yes, please. I'm getting bored here.

message: You see, we want to get back some of what is ours. What we helped to accumulate over the years. We want to hit them where it really hurts.

replies.text: Who's that?
Feygard? Nor City?
The Thieves Guild?

message: Well, yes. But not right now. Those adventures are too big for us right now. I'm talking about the Thieves Guild.

replies.text: Why would you want to do that?

message: Exactly!

replies.text: Why is that?

message: Well, for starters, Umar and his side-kick brother have wronged us over and over again. Keeping all the wealth for themselves. And don't even get me started on the emotional stress and abuse we suffer from at their hands.

replies.text: Um...they do what now?

message: You know what I am talking about. Don't you?

replies.text: I'm not so sure that I do.
Actually, yeah, kind of. Well, at least that thought has crossed my mind once or twice recently.

message: Come on, $playername. Open your eyes. Think. Your are just a tool to him. Something for him to use to accomplish whatever his agenda is that day.

replies.text: Actually, yeah, kind of. Well, at least that thought has crossed my mind once or twice recently.
I'm not so sure, but please, get on with your plan.

message: Anyways...The Guild has a vault. A repository of treasures and wealth hidden and secure in a location just south of Fallhaven.

replies.text: I've been all around the Fallhaven area a thousand times and I've never seen any vault.
I don't believe you. I would have stumbled across it.

message: Oh, trust me, it's there all right.

replies.text: Trust you? You want me to trust you? A dishonorable thief? Where is it then?
Tell me. I want to know.

message: Are you familiar with that vacant house southwest of Fallhaven? The one next to the cliffside?

replies.text: Of course I am.
[Lie] Yes, yes I am.

message: The enterance to it is found inside that house. It's hidden and secured. You will need to find the passage that leads underground in order to gain access.

replies.text: That sounds easy. I'll do it.
I guess I can try and get in there.

message: You won't be doing it.

replies.text: I won't be?

message: Nope. We will be doing that.

replies.text: Then what do you need from me?

message: What I need from you is more of an inside job. I need you to get the key to the vault from Troublemaker without him suspecting any trickery. Do you think you can handle that?

replies.text: Why should I help you? What do I get out of this?
If I do this for you, then I expect to get paid!

message: Oh, you aren't as dumb as you are funny.

replies.text: N

message: How does 10 percent of the total treasure sound?

replies.text: I want 50 percent
How does 30 percent sound?
Nope. I will go no lower than 25 percent
I'll do it for twice that amount. 20 percent.

message: Fine! [Shh] I'll take it out of Greedy's portion. He'll never know the difference.

replies.text: N

message: We will be leaving this campsite in favor of our hideout. Meet up with me there and you can give me the key then.

replies.text: Sounds good, but where is your hideout?

message: It's where the rail tracks end. West of the Sutdover River.
As you sneak a peek inside, a terrifying voice yells out. Warning you not to step foot inside.
Go talk to Defy. I have nothing to say to you.
Great! Give it to me and when I have time, whenever that may be, I will add it to our bank.

replies.text: Well, if you are so busy, I don't mind making the deposit for the greater good.

message: Hmm...well I guess you could do that for me considering Umar trusts you a lot.

replies.text: Great! Just tell me where to go and you can consider it done.

message: Well, it's not that easy. You need more than the location. You need this key.

replies.text: Thanks, but where is vault located?

message: You can find the empty house just south of here. Enter it and you will find your way.

replies.text: Thank you so much! I will bring the key back as quick as possible.

message: You what? How? Where? Tell me all you know.

replies.text: I found them by pure luck really.

message: Where did you find them?

replies.text: Southeast of Deebo's orchard. They were simply sitting in the woods around a campfire enjying some of Sullengard's "Bandit Brews".

message: What else can you tell me?

replies.text: They wanted to hire me to rob you guys. Defy wants your stash of gold and treasures.

message: Really? What did you say?

replies.text: Well, I agreed to, but only because I want to help you guys catch him.

message: You know, $playername, for just being a young adventurer, you are learning a lot.

replies.text: Thanks a lot. I do feel a lot smarter now than I did before joing your guild.

message: Listen, kid. Let's use this to our advantage. Take this fake key, bring it to Defy and we will be waiting for them at the vault.

replies.text: Sir, that sounds like a great plan. What do you want me to do after handing him the fake key?

message: You should got with them to the vault as we may need your help there.

replies.text: Great! Just tell me where to go and you can consider it done.

message: You can find the empty house just south of here. Enter it and you will find your way.

replies.text: I'll be there. Thank you.

message: It's so weird working with you after all that we've gone through.

replies.text: We are not friends.
I would love nothing more than to see you punished for your crimes.
N
What are you waiting for? Go bring the fake key to Troublemaker.
Come and try to get the key!

message: Do you have the key? Hand it over.

replies.text: Oops. I forgot to breing it with me. I'll be back soon.
Yes. Here it is.
Yes, Here it is. [Handing over the fake key]
Yes, but you are not having it. I will loot the vault myself and keep everything I find.

message: Thank you so much. Now take this fake key that Zachlanny's has made and return it to Troublemaker before he suspects anything. Then meet us at the vault to collect your share of the loot.
Thank you very much!
I'm rich. I'm finally rich!

replies.text: Only in gold. You have no friends.

message: Here is your reward for your role in our success.

replies.text: It was nice doing business with you.

message: We are leaving now. To close to Fallhaven for my liking.
Come again?

replies.text: I said, "here it is".
You heard me the first time. I'm keeping the key and looting the vault myself.

message: I will be taking that key now!

replies.text: Come and try.
N

message: I have killed Defy, his three helpers and Alaric. I really should go back to Fallhaven and talk to Troublemaker again.
You what? How? Where? Tell me all you know.

replies.text: Your never going to believe this, but they were inside that vacant house when I walked in.

message: Then what happened?

replies.text: They looked up to no good, so I questioned them. Then the next thing I know, I'm enthralled in the heat of battle and they are dead.

message: Can you prove this? Can you show me something that proves that all 4 are dead?

replies.text: Yes. I looted their rings. [Shows them to Troublemaker]
Yes. I looted their rings, but I forgot to bring them with me. I'll come back.

message: Well, this is great news indeed. We however would like to have them alive.
Thank you so much. Now take this fake key that Zachlanny's has made and return it to Troublemaker before he suspects anything. Then meet us at the vault to collect your share of the loot.

replies.text: N
N

message: Ah, $playername has finally returned.

replies.text: Thank you.

message: You will be happy to hear that we have captured Defy and his four accomplices before they could steal from us.

replies.text: That's great news indeed. Where are they now?

message: We are keeping them in our holding cage in Fallhaven.

replies.text: Is there anything else that I should know about?

message: Yes. That fifth man, the one that was not one of us...

replies.text: You mean Alaric?

message: His name is not important to me...

replies.text: N

message: We've learned that he was part of a crime in Sullengard. You may want to visit Sullengard and inform them that we have there guy.

replies.text: I will. Thank you again.

message: I am here now to watch out for suspicious activity and people.
Hey, you are just the person that I wanted to see. I've been wondering that with all of your adventures, have you encountered "the lost traveler" again?

replies.text: Actually, yes. Yes, I have.

message: Where? Can you get him back here to be punished?

replies.text: Actually, he is in a Fallhaven jail. Locked up with Defy in fact. I was able to capture them and lock them up there.
Actually, I had a chance encounter with him and after attempting to drag him back here, he attacked me and I had no other option than to end his life.

message: Oh, thank you so much!

replies.text: Of course. It was my pleasure.

message: Well, I would have preferred to see him punished instead of killed, but thank you so much for putting an end to all this.

replies.text: Of course. It was my pleasure.

message: Please, take this as a gift of gratitude.

replies.text: Thank you!

message: I don't know if you will like it, but let me tell you, nobody down here wants it.

replies.text: Oh, really? I will play with it. Thanks again.
